intro: Rabdochloa virgata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming during the warmer months. Rabdochloa virgata is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as hibiscus and cotton. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
